subject: Fashion
title: Zero-Waste Pattern Cutting
description: A quick, practical guide to Zero-Waste Pattern Cutting.

hook.text: The average garment wastes 15% of its fabric on the cutting room floor. That's billions of tons yearly.

buildup.text: Traditional pattern cutting creates oddly shaped scraps that can't be reused and go straight to landfill.

discovery.text: Zero-waste designers arrange pieces like a jigsaw puzzle, using every inch of fabric with no leftovers.

twist.text: The technique isn't new. Japanese kimonos were cut from single rectangles with zero waste centuries ago.

climax.text: Modern zero-waste design merges ancient wisdom with digital tools to create complex, waste-free garments.

punchline.text: Zero scraps, zero guilt. The pattern is the solution.
